summary: Email summarizing a call between defense attorneys for Ghislaine Maxwell and prosecutors regarding Maxwell's harsh detention conditions at MDC Brooklyn and plans for a renewed bail application. The defense describes extreme COVID-19 quarantine measures, invasive searches, surveillance of attorney-client meetings, and deteriorating health, while prosecutors agree to review the bail proposal.

events.title: Maxwell Placed in COVID Quarantine
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was abruptly moved and given two COVID-19 tests after a staff member in her area tested positive. She was threatened with 21 days in SHU if she refused the test.

events.title: Attorney-Government Call on Conditions and Bail
events.description: A call between Maxwell's defense attorneys (Cohen, Sternheim, Everdell) and prosecutors to discuss her deteriorating detention conditions and plans to file a renewed bail application.

events.title: Planned Bail Application Meeting
events.description: A meeting scheduled for the upcoming Monday where the defense plans to walk prosecutors through a detailed, confidential renewed bail application they have been preparing for 3.5 months.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's attorneys describe her detention conditions at MDC as unprecedentedly harsh, involving extreme COVID-19 quarantine, invasive strip searches, constant surveillance of attorney-client meetings, and a lack of basic hygiene items.

The defense explicitly links the severity of Maxwell's treatment to the death of Jeffrey Epstein, warning prosecutors that if she gets sick due to BOP conditions, it will create 'another nightmare for the Government'.

Maxwell's defense team has spent 3.5 months preparing a renewed bail application they believe addresses prior court and government concerns, and they seek confidentiality for sensitive financial and co-signer information.

Maxwell's physical and mental health is reportedly deteriorating, with her hair falling out, which her attorney attributes to the stressful and restrictive conditions meant to 'prevent what had happened to Epstein'.

Prosecutors on the call acknowledge the concerns about conditions and agree to review the bail application with an 'open mind,' but decline to preview their position and state they must 'run up the chain' regarding sealing requests.
